results.title: Dalai Lama in Australia production
results.brief_description:
An audio visual recording of the following events as part of the visit to Australia in May 2002 by His Holiness the 14th Dalai Lama of Tibet:

4.00 pm Sunday 19th May 2002: Public Talk by Dalai Lama

8.30 am Monday 20th May 2002: Teaching by Dalai Lama: Atisha’s,
A Lamp to the Path to Enlightenment.

11.15 am Monday 20th May 2002: Victorian Secondary Schools
Event with the Dalai Lama and Sigrid Thornton as MC.
5 Students will ask questions of the Dalai Lama.

2.00 pm Monday 20th May 2002: Teaching by the Dalai Lama:
Atisha’s Lamp to the Path to Enlightenment

9.30 am Tuesday 21st May 2002: Teaching by the Dalai Lama:
Atisha’s Lamp to the Path to Enlightenment

2.00 pm Tuesday 21st May 2002: Teaching by the Dalai Lama:
Atisha’s Lamp to the Path to Enlightenment

9.30 am Wednesday 22nd May 2002: Semkye and Chenrezig Jenang
Empowerment by the Dalai Lama

2.00 pm Wednesday 22nd May 2002: Teaching by the Dalai Lama:
Atisha’s Lamp to the Path to Enlightement

results.title: Jamboree for friendship
results.brief_description: Boy Scouts from one hundred countries take part in the varied activities at the Twelfth Boy Scout Jamboree in Idaho, summer 1967. Youths swap talk and ideas, show each other crafts, national dances and customs, attend religious services, take part in a rodeo and a spectacular night campfire - making friends from around the world.

results.title: The Letter
results.creator_credit: Anne Delaney, Carolyn Johnson and AFTRS
results.brief_description:
A visually beautiful film about the pain, fear and courage of the 19th century novelist Fanny Burney, who had her right breast removed without anaesthetic in 1811. It is based on a letter Fanny wrote to her sister some months later. Cast includes Skye Wansey as Fanny Burney and Rachel Blake as the voice of Fanny Burney.
The original letter now resides in the New York Public Library.

results.creator_credit: Paul Gordon, George Moskov and Official Films
results.brief_description: A Franz Liszt recital performed by Polish-American pianist, Jakob Gimpel featuring “Etude Forest murmurs” and “Etude Un Sospiro” (A Sigh).

results.title: The Shot
results.creator_credit: Puven Pather, Tim Kreibig and AFTRS
results.brief_description: After a prolonged career as a war correspondent photographer, Mick thinks he can see through the horror of the environment he works in, until he falls victim to his own convictions! A look into the moral and ethical dilemmas of a war correspondent. Cast features Tony Martin as Mick and mark Lee as Terry.

results.title: Jake: today I became a man
results.brief_description: Jake is an extraordinary child who just so happens to love dressing up and performing. His resolution to be himself and carve out an identity for himself regardless of societal expectations is inspiring. A remarkable story told in Jake’s language in which he articulately discusses growing up and his love of singing and performing in drag. An eye opening piece which challenges assumptions of personal identity and that kids do understand themselves and their ‘place’ in the world.

results.title: Relative strangers
results.brief_description:
Simon thought he knew his parents… A film about a family, a deception and its legacy.
The visual effects in this film were all camera-created, using a technique of projection onto a moving sheet to create the insubstantial and constantly changing images that reflect the perceptions of the narrator (Simon Cooper). Nothing in his world turned out to be what it first seemed.

results.title: Jagged edge
results.creator_credit: Richard Marquand, Martin Ransohoff and Columbia Pictures
results.brief_description: A well-crafted, hardboiled mystery with sharp perfromances by murder suspect Jeff Bridges and tough-but-smitten defense attorney Glenn Close. The murder victim was a socialite and heiress. Her husband (James Bridges), an upwardly mobile newspaper publisher, now owns his wife’s fortune. Embittered by past experiences with criminal law, Close is pressed to defend Bridges, once he convinces her of his innocence. This movie raises jagged questions about an imperfect justice system and will leave you guessing until the very end - did he or didn’t he? Robert Loggia received a 1985 Academy Award nomination for Best Supporting Actor.

results.title: Castor and Pollux: a tale of two spiritual brothers
results.creator_credit: Phil Noyce, Tom Manefield and AFTRS
results.brief_description: A sometimes humorous, sometimes serious examination of the lifestyles of two middle-aged men in a revolt against conventional living. One is a bikie and the other a hippy.
